result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Stoddard Derry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond to be applied.  Any outstanding amounts to be paid within 60 days or set up payment plan.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Not to possess or consume alcohol.  
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
$290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond to be applied.  Any outstanding amount to be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

timeConds.notes:
Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.
Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.
Credit for 60 days at impatient treatment, along with 25 days in the Polk County Jail for a total of 85 days sentence credit if revoked.
50 hours of Community Service must be completed during each year of Probation for a total of 150 hours.

Associated with Charge #1

11:07 a.m. Defendant Christopher Stoddard Derry in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  Per Atty Biller - did not adequately receive the PSI.  Asking for continuance.  Ct grants continuance.  After speaking with DE, Atty Biller withdraws motion for continuance.  Per ADA - asking for 60 days to submit Rest. Request on count 4.   Atty Biller addresses Ct.  DE addresses ct.  Can not possess firearm.  can not vote.  can not hold elective office.  Ct finds eligible for programs.  Ct goes over PCR.  11:45 adj. 

Count 1 -  Ct WH sentence.  Probation.  Credit for 2 years sobriety, probation is for 3 years.  1 year conditional jail time, banked.  Subj to WR, not subj to GT.  DL revoked for 2 years, but credit for any administrative suspension.  Credit for 60 days at impatient treatement along with 25 days in PCJ for 85 days credit if revoked.  Fines/Costs $290.60.  DNA Sample $200.00.  No Alcohol.  Maintain employment.  Credit for community service.  Court orders addl 50 hours per year for each year on probation.  Bond to be applied towards costs.  60 days to set up PP with COCC.  Sign up with probation today.  

Count 4 - Victim has 60 days for Rest.  Atty Biller has 60 days thereafter for response.  WH sent.  probation 1 year, concurent with count 1.   Fine/Costs of $265.60  and DNA sample $200.00.  Ct will amend sentence to no court costs on count 4 and withdraws $265.60.  No community service on Count 4.
